contentrichtext.text: {{Infobox Hieroglyphen |TITEL = Am-heh |NAME = <hiero>a-m-A2-C11-Z1</hiero> |NAME-TRANSKRIPTION = Am-heh |NAME-ERKLÃ„RUNG = ''devourer of millions'' }} In [[Egyptian mythology]], '''Am-heh''' was a minor god from the underworld, whose name means "devourer of millions". He was depicted as a man with the head of a dog who lived in a lake of fire. Am-heh could only be controlled by the god [[Atum]].<ref>George Hart, The Routledge dictionary of Egyptian gods and goddesses, Psychology Press, 2005, [http://books.google.com/books?id=yTNxvArA5YIC&lpg=PA12&dq=am-heh%20god%20underworld&pg=PA12#v=onepage&q=am-heh%20god%20underworld&f=false via Google Books]</ref> He is sometimes confused with [[Ammit]], another underworld creature who ate the hearts of dead who did not pass the scales of [[Ma'at]].{{Citation needed|date=November 2010}} ==References== <references/> {{DEFAULTSORT:Am-Heh}} [[Category:Egyptian gods]] [[Category:Underworld gods]] [[Category:Egyptian mythology]] {{Egyptian-myth-stub}} [[ca:Am-heh]]
